hero.title: Breathing, Moving, Waiting
hero.subtitle: How Net-Zero Transforms Your Air Plus Your Commute
hero.hook: Net-Zero is not just about cutting emissions. It is about how you live your daily life. Imagine cleaner air, calmer streets, and a healthier you. Would you change how you travel for that?
hero.tagline: Walk more. Wait a bit. Breathe easier. Win overall.

sectionB.title: Three Lines, One Story
sectionB.subtitle: Air, Movement, Traffic: How Benefits Stack Up
sectionB.intro: Net-Zero does not help everyone equally. We looked at 46,426 small areas across the UK. Each line here shows a different transformation story.

step1.title: Lower Benefit Areas
step1.text: Around 30% of areas get modest gains. Think rural spots with little traffic or air that is already pretty clean. Limited infrastructure means limited change.

step2.title: Medium Benefit Areas
step2.text: Then you have 40% of areas with solid improvements. Physical activity benefits vary wildly here. Some places hit over 25 million pounds.

step3.title: Higher Benefit Areas
step3.text: The top 30% see huge wins. Busy urban centers with heavy traffic get the biggest payoff. Cleaner air means healthier people who move more.

sectionC.title: Breathing vs. Moving
sectionC.subtitle: Does Cleaner Air Get You Moving?
sectionC.intro: We checked all 46,426 areas. A pattern jumped out. Cleaner air pushes people to be more active. Every dot you see is one community changing.
sectionC.insight: The correlation is not perfect (R-squared equals 0.134). But the trend is clear. Better air quality means more walking and biking. Cut car emissions and people naturally move their bodies more.

sectionPopulation.title: The Human Scale
sectionPopulation.subtitle: 67 Million Lives Changed
sectionPopulation.intro: Numbers tell part of the story. But real people breathe this air. Real people walk these streets. Real people adapt. So who wins most?

highBenefit.label: Big Winners
highBenefit.description: People in areas gaining over 5 million pounds

mediumBenefit.label: Solid Gains
mediumBenefit.description: People in areas gaining 1 to 5 million pounds

lowBenefit.label: Modest Improvements
lowBenefit.description: People in areas gaining under 1 million pounds

sectionPopulation.insight: Most UK residents come out ahead with Net-Zero. Cities grab the biggest wins. Rural areas need smart infrastructure to catch up.

sectionHeatmap.title: Where Are These Places?
sectionHeatmap.subtitle: Net Benefit Across the UK
sectionHeatmap.intro: Every community tells a different story. Click any spot on the map to dig into how Net-Zero hits your neighborhood.

sectionD.title: Worth the Wait?
sectionD.subtitle: Big Wins vs. Extra Minutes: Do You Come Out Ahead?
sectionD.intro: Net-Zero gives you cleaner air plus better health. But what about the downsides? Longer trips. New routines. Real costs. So does it pay off?
sectionD.insight: Short answer: yes! In 70% of areas (groups 4 through 10), you win big. Hassle costs run from 1.1 to 1.8 million pounds. But top areas rack up 9.5 million pounds in benefits.

breakdown.d1to3: Groups 1-3 (30%): Benefits are negative or near zero. These spots need better roads and transit.
breakdown.d4to7: Groups 4-7 (40%): Decent gains of 0.5 to 3 million pounds. The switch is working.
breakdown.d8to10: Groups 8-10 (30%): Massive wins of 3 to 9.5 million pounds. Net-Zero at full power.
